com.github.dm.jrt.core.config

Class ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.core.config.ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>
  • Type Parameters:
    TYPE - the configurable object type.
    Enclosing class:
    ChannelConfiguration

    public static final class ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>
extends Object
    Builder of channel configurations.

      • with

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> with(@Nullable
                                              ChannelConfiguration configuration)
        Applies the specified configuration to this builder. A null value means that all the configuration options will be reset to their default, otherwise only the non-default options will be applied.
        Parameters:
        configuration - the channel configuration.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withChannelLimit

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withChannelLimit(int limit)
        Sets the limit of data that the channel can retain before starting to slow down the feeding thread. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        This configuration option is useful when the data coming from the invocation execution are meant to be explicitly read through this channel. The execution will slow down until enough data are consumed. Note, however, that binding the channel to an output consumer will make the option ineffective.

        Parameters:
        limit - the limit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the limit is negative.

      • withChannelMaxDelay

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withChannelMaxDelay(long delay,
                                                             @NotNull
                                                             TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the maximum delay to apply to the feeding thread waiting for the channel to have room for additional data.

        This configuration option should be used on conjunction with the channel limit, or it might have no effect on the invocation execution.

        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        timeUnit - the timeout time unit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified delay is negative.

      • withChannelMaxDelay

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withChannelMaxDelay(@Nullable
                                                             TimeDuration delay)
        Sets the maximum delay to apply to the feeding thread waiting for the channel to have room for additional data.

        This configuration option should be used on conjunction with the channel limit, or it might have no effect on the invocation execution.

        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withChannelMaxSize

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withChannelMaxSize(int maxSize)
        Sets the maximum number of data that the channel can retain before they are consumed. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - the maximum size.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is less than 1.

      • withChannelOrder

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withChannelOrder(@Nullable
                                                          InvocationConfiguration.OrderType orderType)
        Sets the order in which data are collected from the channel. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration, since the channel order can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.

        Parameters:
        orderType - the order type.
        Returns:
        this builder.

public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withLog(@Nullable

        Parameters:
        log - the log instance.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withReadTimeout

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeout(long timeout,
                                                         @NotNull
                                                         TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the timeout for the channel instance to produce a readable output.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration, since the output timeout can be dynamically changed through the dedicated channel methods.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout.
        timeUnit - the timeout time unit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified timeout is negative.

      • withReadTimeout

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeout(@Nullable
                                                         TimeDuration timeout)
        Sets the timeout for the channel instance to produce a readable output. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration, since the output timeout can be dynamically changed through the dedicated channel methods.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withReadTimeoutAction

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeoutAction(@Nullable
                                                               InvocationConfiguration.TimeoutActionType actionType)
        Sets the action to be taken if the timeout elapses before an output can be read from the output channel. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.

        Note that this is just the initial configuration, since the output timeout action can be dynamically changed through the dedicated channel methods.

        Parameters:
        actionType - the action type.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withRunner

        @NotNull
public ChannelConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withRunner(@Nullable
                                                    Runner runner)
        Sets the asynchronous runner instance. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        runner - the runner instance.
        Returns:
        this builder.
